intro: Hymenodictyon occidentale var. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth hymenodictyon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and dense foliage. Its botanical features include simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It is often found in tropical and subtropical environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
